bibl.title: Michael Henan v. John H. McGraw. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: Territory of Washington, } ss. County of King.
To any constable and the keeper of the jail of said County

p.del: at a Justice's Court hold at my office, in said county, for the trial of _____ for the offense hereinafter stated the said _____, in said county, committed _____ and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that said _____ should pay a fine of _____ dollars, and _____ dollars, costs, and stand committed until the same be paid: and, whereas, the said ___ has made default in the payment of the same. Therefore, you, the said are hereby commanded

body.p: WHEREAS, F.C. Heenan of King Co W.T. has been brought this day before the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, charged on the oath of F.L. Baugs with having, on the 30th day of June 1885 in said County, committed the offense of Grand Larceny, and in progress of the trial of said charge it appearing to the said Justice that the said F.C. Heenan has been guilty of the said offense, committed at the time and place aforesaid. And whereas the said F.C. Heenan has failed to give bail in the sum of Two Hundred and fifty dollars for his appearance to answer at the next term of the District Court, as required by me.

Therefore, you, the said Sheriff or Constable in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliver the said F.C. Heenan to the said keeper: and you, the said keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said F.C. Heenan into your custody in said jail, and him there safely keep until the session of the District Court next following or until he shall be discharged by due course of law.
Dated this 20th day of July 1885. G.A. Hill Justice of the Peace in and for King County W.T.
Territory of Washington } County of King

I hereby certify that I served the by virtue of the within commitment I delivered the within named F.C. Heenan into the custody of the Keeper of the Jail of J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County he being the Jailor of said King County Jail of ___ this ___ day of ___ 1888_ Dated July 20th 1885
Office of the Sheriff of King County, W.T.
I hereby certify the within to be a true copy of the original committment left at my office by the said Constable.
Dated at Seattle the 22nd day of August 1885 J.H. McGraw Sheriff By D.R. McKinley Dep
